title: @RiotRepertoir Enough is enough
body:
All this time you have been avoiding the single most important point of the entirely of Garen's rework. Well, **no more** i say!

When Garen got his VU, he lost two extremely important things:

Somersault on Q and Punch as one of his autos.

Now that he is being reworked, this is the time! There are people at Riot looking at him!

Repertoir, this is the one chance Garen has. Do not let his ability to punch evil-doers be destroyed! Do not allow his ability to spin mid-air to be gone permanently!

You can make a difference here. Save Garen!

replies.body:
It's funny how often this is requested.

Honestly, I don't think the old animations even exist anymore. If they did, I might throw them in there as a 1 in 100 chance to occur or something.

Sorry dude, you're going to have to settle for your jump strike and sword slashes.

Downvote me. I've just delivered bad news :(

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E6uZsQcE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-08-10T07:58:49.314+0000)
>
> Honestly, I don't think the old animations even exist anymore.

That just irritates me. Not the punch situation, but the fact that that you guys completely delete old assets instead of archiving them. What the fuck? Who does that?

For a little context on this, it's not like they are deleted because they are taking up too much space or because we have a firm stance that jump strike is better than somersault strike. When Garen's VU was done several years ago, he got a whole new character model and rig, and so the animations for the old one just literally will not work for the new one.

Now, a new animation could _technically_ be made, but this update is one that focuses mostly on gameplay updates, so taking animators off their other tasks to recreate an animation isn't really fair to them.
just a question so does that mean that the animations exist still on someones hard drive, simply unusable for the current model or were they completly erased from existensce?

Even if they have been 'deleted', they are almost certainly recoverable.

But yeah, unusable for the modern day model.
thanks wanted to know about that.
Most likely if they applied the animation to Garen, it would cause his model to freak out since they have different animation rigging.
yeah but I was focused more so on whether or not it could be archived which means it doesn't need to be usable it just needs to exist.
It is most likely archived somewhere, though it isn't unheard of to delete very old resources. If you want an example of why not to do this, check out Pikadorf and other moves swapping on SSB Brawl.
I know I just prefer the Pokémon style of leaving everything in simply because it allows access to things that may remind people why or why not something was put in.
The Garen VU was quite awhile ago. It's probably not even their fault that it's gone.

And I Imagine It'd probably be outside your resource budget to Make a New Baddie-punching animation for Garen?

(Not trying to be snarky, I mean the question as-is, no Sarcasm included.)

I frequently wish that I had some skills in Visual Effects, Animations, or Sound Design so that I could do stuff like this in my free time without taking co-workers that actually have their skills off their current tasks.

There's a reason I don't do these things, though. The results wouldn't be pretty.

Can someone explain to me why a post as irrelevant as this got a red comment within two hours, but all of the things that actually matter still await a reply of any kind, red or not?

I've been trying to pop into threads that have a more serious tone as well, but if there are easy questions like op's, they can be easy to answer as well. It's not really a matter of trying to dodge a touchy or difficult subject or only respond to silly threads.

What's the one question that matters most to you? I'll do my best to answer it if I have an answer/opinion. I might not have an answer, but I'll let you know if that's the case.

I know my previous response sounded a bit sarcastic, and I'm sorry for that. I deleted it. It's kinda like staying up all night to study for a test only to find out the next day that the test was cancelled. I put my best thought into most of my posts, and when nobody even looks at it, it makes me feel like i wasted my time. 

I do totally understand what you're saying though. It's easier to give a straight response if the conversation doesn't carry much weight.

I also apologize for being so late to respond, but if you're still interested in at least reading at what I have to say, you can find it [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/VzLrUveH-the-new-fiorabetter-but-worse). Thanks for the response. :)
